refined_content.label: def-cloning-probability-function
refined_content.name: Conditional Cloning Probability Function
refined_content.statement: The **Conditional Cloning Probability Function**, denoted $\pi: \mathbb{R}_{\ge 0} \times \mathbb{R}_{\ge 0} \to [0, 1]$, maps the fitness potential of a companion ($v_c$) and a primary walker ($v_i$) to the probability that the "Clone" action is selected.
refined_content.description: This function defines the probability of a 'Clone' action occurring based on the fitness potentials of two walkers (a companion and a primary walker). It is calculated by comparing the cloning score to a randomly drawn threshold, effectively clipping the normalized score to the valid probability range of [0, 1].

relations.description: The cloning probability is the probability that the score S(v_c, v_i) exceeds a uniform random threshold T_clone. This is equivalent to clipping the normalized score S(v_c, v_i) / p_max to the interval [0, 1].

refined_content.label: def-cloning-score-function
refined_content.name: Cloning Score Function
refined_content.statement: The **Cloning Score Function**, $S: \mathbb{R}_{\ge 0} \times \mathbb{R}_{\ge 0} \to \mathbb{R}$, takes the fitness potential of a companion walker ($v_c$) and a primary walker ($v_i$) and computes a raw score.
refined_content.description: This function computes a raw, unnormalized score that quantifies the relative fitness advantage of a companion walker over a primary walker. The score is regularized by a small constant epsilon in the denominator to prevent division by zero.

relations.description: The score is the difference in fitness potentials, normalized by the primary walker's fitness potential (plus a regularizer).
